required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exenatide Versus Glimepiride in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Treatment With Exenatide Versus Glimepiride in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Pretreated With Metformin (EUREXA: European Exenatide Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the effects of twice-daily subcutaneous injection exenatide versus treatment with sulfonylurea (glimepiride) on long-term glycemic control and beta-cell function.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Treatment Failure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.

secondary_outcome.measure: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Beta-cell Function (HOMA-B) at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA-B at Year 3. HOMA-B is an index of beta-cell function and was calculated as: HOMA-B = (20 x fasting insulin (measured in pmol/L))/((fasting glucose (measured in mmol/L) - 3.5) x 7.175).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HOMA-B From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HOMA-B from baseline to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Proinsulin/Insulin Ratio at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting proinsulin (measured in pmol/L)/insulin (measured in pmol/L) ratio at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Proinsulin/Insulin Ratio From Baseline to Endpoint.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting proinsulin (measured in pmol/L)/insulin (measured in pmol/L) ratio from baseline to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of the 30 Minute Increment in Plasma Insulin Concentration and the 30 Minute Increment in Plasma Glucose During the Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (DI30/DG30 Ratio) at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: DI30/DG30 at Year 3. DI30/DG30 ratio was calculated as (30 minute post prandial insulin - fasting insulin) (measured in pmol/L)/(30 minute post prandial glucose - fasting glucose) (measured in mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in DI30/DG30 Ratio From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in DI30/DG30 ratio from baseline to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disposition Index at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Disposition Index at Year 3. Disposition index was calculated as (DI30/DG30 ratio)/(HOMA index for insulin resistance (HOMA-IR)); where HOMA-IR=(fasting insulin (measured in pmol/L) x fasting glucose (measured in mmol/L))/(22.5 x 7.175).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disposition Index From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in disposition index from baseline to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to endpoint. Endpoint for HbA1c was defined as the HbA1c measured at the treatment failure for patients reaching primary endpoint and was the last observation in study period II for other patients (either followed until the end of the study period II or discontinuing the study).

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Plasma Glucose at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting plasma glucose at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial (2 Hours) Plasma Glucose at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Postprandial (2 hours) plasma glucose at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Postprandial (2 Hours) Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in postprandial (2 hours) plasma glucose to endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Body weight from baseline to Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Blood pressure at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Diastolic Blood Pressure at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic Blood pressure at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Triglycerides at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Triglycerides at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Cholesterol at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: Total Cholesterol at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: High-density Lipoprotein (HDL) Cholesterol at Year 3
secondary_outcome.description: HDL Cholesterol at Year 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Randomized at Entry in Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline in Period III, Year 2 in Period III
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Not Randomized at Entry in Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline in Period III, Year 2 in Period III
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year in Period III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Period III to end of study
secondary_outcome.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.

intervention.description: subcutaneous injection (5mcg or 10mcg), twice a day
oral tablet (titrated to maximally tolerated dose), once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
- Treated with diet and exercise and a stable, maximally tolerated dose of metformin for at least 3 months prior to screening.
- HbA1c >=6.5% and <=9.0%.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) >=25 kg/m^2 and <40 kg/m^2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participated in an interventional medical, surgical, or pharmaceutical study within 30 days prior to screening.
- Characteristics contraindicating metformin or glimepiride use.
- Receiving drugs that directly affect gastrointestinal motility.
- Receiving chronic (lasting longer than 2 weeks) systemic glucocorticoid therapy.
- Have used any prescription drug to promote weight loss within 3 months prior to screening.
- Treated for longer than 2 weeks with any of the following medications within 3 months prior to screening: *insulin; *thiazolidinediones; *alpha-glucosidase inhibitors; *sulfonylurea; *meglitinides

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients meeting defined failure of HbA1c control (primary endpoint) in Study Period II were eligible for entry to Study Period III

group.title: Period II, Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Period III, Exen + Met + Glim - Randomized
group.description: Glimepiride once daily, started at 1 mg dose and titrated up to maintenance doses, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period III, Exen + Met + Pio or Rosi - Randomized
group.description: Oral Rosiglitazone or Pioglitazone once or twice daily, started 15 mg per day, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period III, Glim + Met + Exen - Not Randomized
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for the first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period III) was added to oral Glimepiride once daily and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period II, Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Age
Gender

Weight

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population: Enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement of HbA1c in Study Period II (including only Study Period II); patients analyzed according to treatment as randomized.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Number of Patients With Treatment Failure
measure.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population: Enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement of HbA1c in Study Period II (including only Study Period II); patients analyzed according to treatment as randomized.

class.title: Number of patients with treatment failure

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis (H0) and alternative hypothesis (H1) for the primary analysis (i.e., non-inferiority) are:H0: hazards of treatment for Exenatide/hazards of treatment for Glimepiride >=1.25.H1: hazards of treatment for Exenatide/hazards of treatment for Glimepiride < 1.25. With 527 patients in each arm, the study would have approximately 90% power to conclude non-inferiority of Exenatide to Glimepiride.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non inferiority test was based on the upper 1-sided 97.5% CI for the hazard ratio of Exenatide/Glimepiride;the upper bound was compared to 1.25: if <1.25, the hypothesis that the risk of treatment failure with Exenatide is more than 1.25 times greater than the risk with Glimepiride is rejected.Superiority test was based on the 2-sided 95% CI for the hazard ratio. If CI excludes 1, the hypothesis that the risk of treatment failure with Exenatide is equal to that with Glimepiride is rejected.
analysis.method_desc: Time to treatment failure was modeled using Cox regression with treatment and baseline HbA1c as predictive terms.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure
measure.description: Treatment failure is defined as one of the following:1. HbA1c exceeding 9% at any visit after the initial 3 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 6), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents. 2. HbA1c exceeding 7% at 2 consecutive visits 3 months apart, after the initial 6 months of treatment (i.e., earliest at Month 9), on the maximally tolerated dose of antidiabetic agents.
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population.

measurement_list.measurement: Since the last observed time point, beyond which all are missing, is still within the 95% confidence interval for the median survival time, the upper bound should be no less than the last observed time point, and is unknown due to censoring.

analysis.groups_desc: Kaplan-Meier survival curves for time to treatment failure were compared between treatment groups using log rank test.

outcome.title: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Beta-cell Function (HOMA-B) at Year 3
outcome.description: HOMA-B at Year 3. HOMA-B is an index of beta-cell function and was calculated as: HOMA-B = (20 x fasting insulin (measured in pmol/L))/((fasting glucose (measured in mmol/L) - 3.5) x 7.175).
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population. The analysis included only time points up to that week where at least 25% of the originally enrolled population was still in the study. Missing data at Year 3 was not imputed.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Beta-cell Function (HOMA-B) at Year 3
measure.description: HOMA-B at Year 3. HOMA-B is an index of beta-cell function and was calculated as: HOMA-B = (20 x fasting insulin (measured in pmol/L))/((fasting glucose (measured in mmol/L) - 3.5) x 7.175).
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population. The analysis included only time points up to that week where at least 25% of the originally enrolled population was still in the study. Missing data at Year 3 was not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: Mixed-model Repeated Measures (MMRM) analysis includes treatment, visit, and treatment by visit interaction, and baseline value as a covariate. The unstructured covariance matrix was used.

outcome.title: Change in HOMA-B From Baseline to Endpoint
outcome.description: Change in HOMA-B from baseline to endpoint.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Change in HOMA-B From Baseline to Endpoint
measure.description: Change in HOMA-B from baseline to endpoint.
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

analysis.groups_desc: Change in HOMA-B from baseline to endpoint was analyzed by an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model that includes treatment and baseline HbA1c stratum (<=7.3%, >7.3% to <=8.2%, >8.2%) as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Fasting Proinsulin/Insulin Ratio at Year 3
outcome.description: Fasting proinsulin (measured in pmol/L)/insulin (measured in pmol/L) ratio at Year 3.
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population. The analysis included only time points up to that week where at least 25% of the originally enrolled population was still in the study. Missing data at Year 3 was not imputed.

group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose at Year 3
measure.description: Fasting plasma glucose at Year 3.
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population. The analysis included only time points up to that week where at least 25% of the originally enrolled population was still in the study. Missing data at Year 3 was not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: MMRM includes treatment, visit, and treatment by visit interaction, and baseline value as a covariate. The unstructured covariance matrix was used.

outcome.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Endpoint
outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
outcome.population: ITT Efficacy Population. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using LOCF approach.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Endpoint
measure.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint.
measure.population: ITT Efficacy Population. Missing data at endpoint was imputed using LOCF approach.

analysis.groups_desc: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline to endpoint was analyzed by an ANCOVA model that includes treatment and baseline HbA1c stratum (<=7.3%, >7.3% to <=8.2%, >8.2%) as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year
outcome.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of Period II (up to 4.5 years)
outcome.population: ITT Safety Population.

group.title: Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

measure.title: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year
measure.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.
measure.population: ITT Safety Population.

analysis.groups_desc: The number of hypoglycemic episodes by patient were compared between treatment groups using a negative binomial model with effects for treatment and baseline HbA1c and the logarithm of the days of exposure as the offset variable.

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Randomized at Entry in Period III
outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline in Period III, Year 2 in Period III
outcome.population: Extension ITT Efficacy Population: Extension enrolled patients with at least one post-baseline measurement of HbA1c in Study Period III. The analysis included patients randomized at entry in study period III. Missing data at Year 2 was not imputed.

group.title: Exen + Met + Glim - Randomized
group.description: Glimepiride once daily, started at 1 mg dose and titrated up to maintenance doses, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Exen + Met + Pio or Rosi - Randomized
group.description: Oral Rosiglitazone or Pioglitazone once or twice daily, started 15 mg per day, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Randomized at Entry in Period III
measure.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.
measure.population: Extension ITT Efficacy Population: Extension enrolled patients with at least one post-baseline measurement of HbA1c in Study Period III. The analysis included patients randomized at entry in study period III. Missing data at Year 2 was not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: MMRM analysis includes treatment, visit, and treatment by visit interaction, and baseline value at Period III as a covariate. The compound symmetric covariance structure was assumed.

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Not Randomized at Entry in Period III
outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline in Period III, Year 2 in Period III
outcome.population: Extension ITT Efficacy population. The analysis included patients not randomized at entry in study period III. Missing data at Year 2 was not imputed.

group.title: Glim + Met + Exen - Not Randomized
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for the first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period III) was added to oral Glimepiride once daily and daily oral Metformin in Period III

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Year 2 for Patients Not Randomized at Entry in Period III
measure.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to Year 2.
measure.population: Extension ITT Efficacy population. The analysis included patients not randomized at entry in study period III. Missing data at Year 2 was not imputed.

outcome.title: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year in Period III
outcome.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.
outcome.time_frame: Start of Period III to end of study
outcome.population: Extension ITT Safety Population: Extension enrolled patients receiving at least one dose of study medication in Study Period III.

group.title: Exen + Metformin + Glim - Randomized
group.description: Glimepiride once daily, started at 1 mg dose and titrated up to maintenance doses, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Exen + Met + Pio or Rosi - Randomized
group.description: Oral Rosiglitazone or Pioglitazone once or twice daily, started 15 mg per day, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Glim + Met + Exen - Not Randomized
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for the first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period III) was added to oral Glimepiride once daily and daily oral Metformin in Period III

measure.title: Hypoglycemia Rate Per Year in Period III
measure.description: All hypoglycemia episodes were taken into account. Severe hypoglycemia: event requiring assistance of another person to administer carbohydrate, glucagons, or other resuscitative actions; Documented symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with typical symptoms accompanied by a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Asymptomatic hypoglycemia: event not accompanied by typical symptoms but with a measured plasma glucose concentration <=70 mg/dL; Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia: event with symptoms not accompanied by a plasma glucose determination.
measure.population: Extension ITT Safety Population: Extension enrolled patients receiving at least one dose of study medication in Study Period III.

group.title: Period II, Glim + Met
group.description: Glimepiride one 1 mg tablet daily with subsequent titration every 4 weeks to maximally-tolerated dose for the remainder of Period II and daily oral Metformin

group.title: Period III, Exen + Met + Glim - Randomized
group.description: Glimepiride once daily, started at 1 mg dose and titrated up to maintenance doses, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period III, Exen + Met + Pio or Rosi - Randomized
group.description: Oral Rosiglitazone or Pioglitazone once or twice daily, started 15 mg per day, was added to Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period III, Glim + Met + Exen - Not Randomized
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for the first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period III) was added to oral Glimepiride once daily and daily oral Metformin in Period III

group.title: Period II, Exen + Met
group.description: Exenatide 10 mcg twice daily subcutaneously injected (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks followed by 10 mcg exenatide per dose for the remainder of period II) and daily oral Metformin

event.sub_title: Haemophilia A with anti factor VIII

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified
Small cell lung cancer stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Only patients who reached primary endpoint 12 months or more before the projected end of the study could enter period III.
